list_definition.definition: the decoration of a room etc and the arrangement of the objects in it

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: It was a comfortable room, but I didn’t like the decor.

list_ex_of_english: All the workmen spoke very highly of the effect of having good colour schemes and decor.
Their decor, service, and cuisine are on the highest international level—and so, quite rightly, are their bills.
The landscape and the room decor are so different in kind that they seem merely juxtaposed on either side of the glazing.
A chronological examination of die libretti demonstrates, however, a gradual demand for realism to the extent that writing and decor became more equally weighted.
The outside decor lends itself to system-build, which is sometimes very good, but sometimes—as we know from experience — it is disastrous.
All aspects of the decor in this room defer to the desire on the part of travellers to belong in the landscape.
They found a home that had a similar floor plan and decor to his own, and reported that he had settled in quite comfortably.
The decor creates a frame of representation which strongly suggests a particular mood.
